name: Chat with Assistant
definition: This capability provides a conversational chatbot service that enables users to ask questions, have engaging discussions, and receive clear explanations. It accepts natural language text input and returns helpful, context-aware responses.

name: Provide Conversational Assistance
definition: Engages in multi-turn dialogue to answer questions, provide explanations, offer definitions, analogies, summaries, and clarify ambiguous instructions. Input: natural language queries; Output: detailed and contextual textual responses.

name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: Performs structured text editing tasks including find-and-replace, applying templates, and other content transformations. Input: text content and specific editing or replacement instructions; Output: the transformed text after applying the modifications.

name: Answer Questions
definition: This capability provides general question answering using the OWL-based general task assistant. It accepts a user query in natural language as input and returns a text response that answers the query.

name: Chat with Gaia Assistant
definition: Provides an AI assistant service where users can ask questions and receive conversational responses. Inputs include plain text queries, and outputs are text responses.

name: Execute Academic Signal Processing Pipeline
definition: This capability performs an end-to-end academic signal processing task by sequentially executing data collection, signal interpretation, trend recommendation, and report generation. It accepts inputs such as a query date, research topic, and any additional parameters, and returns a comprehensive academic report that integrates raw data, analytical insights, and actionable recommendations.

name: Collect Academic Signals
definition: This capability collects raw academic data based on user-defined criteria such as date, research field, and keywords. It accepts these parameters as inputs and produces a dataset of academic signals, including papers, events, or other relevant academic outputs.

name: Interpret Academic Signals
definition: This capability analyzes the collected academic data to extract trends, insights, and progress in a specified research area. It accepts raw academic data or query parameters (such as date and topic) as inputs and produces a summary of interpreted trends and developments.

name: Recommend Academic Trends
definition: This capability generates actionable recommendations or predictions based on the interpreted academic signals. It accepts inputs such as analytical results or specific research focus parameters, and outputs recommendations on emerging trends or strategic research directions.

name: Generate Academic Report
definition: This capability consolidates collected academic data, interpreted insights, and trend recommendations into a comprehensive report. It accepts inputs such as processed academic signals and summary insights, and produces a formatted academic report detailing progress, trends, and actionable information.

name: Optimize User Prompt
definition: This capability accepts a user-provided prompt (text) and optimizes it to improve AI response quality and effectiveness. The input is a plain text prompt, and the output is an enhanced version that clarifies the intent and improves engagement.

name: Iterative Prompt Optimization
definition: This capability performs iterative refinement of an already optimized prompt based on specific user feedback. It accepts as input the current optimized prompt along with feedback details, and produces a further improved version that incorporates additional context or specificity.

name: Generate Mermaid Diagram
definition: Creates a Mermaid diagram such as flowcharts, sequence diagrams, class diagrams, etc., based on user-provided textual descriptions and diagram requirements. Input: textual description with diagram type and details; Output: Mermaid diagram code.

name: Filter and Recommend Papers
definition: This service receives a JSON object input containing a key 'arxiv_ids' with a list of ArXiv paper IDs. It retrieves detailed metadata for these papers, applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and recommendation logic based on preset semantic rules, and returns a JSON list of up to 8 recommended ArXiv IDs in the recommended order.

name: Extract, Filter, and Recommend Papers
definition: This service receives a natural language text input that contains one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts all valid ArXiv IDs from the provided text, retrieves the corresponding paper metadata, applies intelligent filtering and sorting based on internal logic, and returns a JSON list of up to 8 recommended ArXiv IDs ordered by their recommendation.

name: Analyze paper by ArXiv IDs
definition: This capability accepts a JSON object containing a list of ArXiv paper IDs. It retrieves the corresponding papers from the ArXiv platform, performs in-depth content analysis, and returns a JSON list where each entry is a Markdown-formatted interpretation report of a paper.

name: Extract and analyze ArXiv papers
definition: This capability accepts a text input that includes one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the provided text, retrieves the corresponding papers, performs comprehensive analysis, and returns a JSON list with Markdown-formatted summary reports for each paper.

name: Analyze attached PDF papers
definition: This capability accepts messages with attached PDF files containing academic papers. It reads and analyzes the content of each attached PDF, conducts in-depth summarization, and returns a JSON list where each entry is a Markdown-formatted analysis and summary report of the corresponding paper.

name: Download Paper PDFs
definition: This capability accepts a JSON object as input with a key 'arxiv_ids' containing a list of ArXiv paper IDs. It downloads the PDF file for each specified paper, encodes the file content in Base64, and produces a JSON list where each element is the Base64 encoded string of a corresponding PDF.

name: Extract ArXiv IDs and Download PDFs
definition: This capability accepts a natural language text input that includes one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts all valid ArXiv IDs from the text, downloads the PDF files for each identified paper, encodes the contents in Base64, and returns a JSON list with each entry being the Base64 encoded PDF content.

name: Search Arxiv Papers
definition: This capability receives a natural language instruction (e.g., 'yesterday's AI papers') or a structured JSON query object as input. It processes the input to perform a search on the Arxiv database and returns a JSON-formatted string containing a list of paper metadata (including title, authors, abstract, etc.) as output.

name: Analyze Research Papers
definition: This capability processes academic research papers to extract specific research ideas and directions. It accepts inputs such as the text or file paths of research papers and outputs a summary of potential research ideas and inspirations.

name: Identify Research Gaps
definition: This capability examines academic literature to detect gaps and unexplored areas in current research. It accepts inputs like the text or references to research papers and outputs a list of identified research gaps and opportunities for further investigation.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts a natural language search query related to academic topics as input and returns a formatted list of up to 5 relevant academic papers. Each paper in the output includes the title, authors with publication year, source (e.g., arXiv or Semantic Scholar), a truncated abstract if necessary, and direct links to the paper and its PDF. Users can input queries such as 'Find papers about transformer attention mechanisms' or 'Search for recent papers on reinforcement learning'.

name: Review PDF Paper
definition: This capability reviews an academic paper provided as a PDF file. It accepts input in the form of a file message containing a PDF (with the file name ending in .pdf and base64-encoded content). The output is a comprehensive review report in structured markdown format that includes paper metadata (title, authors, year, source), scoring (methodology, novelty, clarity, significance on a scale from 1 to 10), a detailed summary, strengths, weaknesses, and pertinent questions.

name: Review Paper from URL
definition: This capability reviews an academic paper directly from its URL. It accepts a text message containing a URL (e.g., an arXiv link) and automatically downloads the corresponding PDF, extracts necessary text and metadata, and generates a comprehensive review report. The review includes structured scoring for methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance, along with a detailed analysis of the paper.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: This capability provides information about the agent's available functions and how to use them. It accepts input in the form of greeting or help queries (such as 'Hello', 'What can you do?', etc.) and returns a textual explanation outlining the agent's capabilities, including paper review and analysis functions.

name: Browse the Web
definition: This capability accepts user queries or questions that require up-to-date information and performs a web browsing operation. It retrieves and returns relevant data or answers by searching the internet, such as current weather conditions or topic-specific information.
